title.narrative: Expanding access to sexual and reproductive health services among populations in newly accessible LGAs of Borno State, North Eastern Nigeria-

description.narrative: The project is intended to build on previous efforts by UNFPA, the State Ministry of Health and other partners in improving access to SRH services in newly accessible areas. The focus will be on key activities as outlined in the Interagency Minimum Initial Service Package (MISP) for SRH in humanitarian settings. However special efforts will be undertaken to address the early recovery and development needs of the health system which will enhance its responsiveness to the needs of the communities as they transition to full recovery. A mix of quick gain interventions based on outreach services, mobile clinics, specialized centers for adolescents and young people and medium to long term investments in equipment, capacity building will be used in this project. Access to emergency obstetric services will be strengthened through dissemination of information on available services in all activities to be undertaken. Provision of RH kits for the health facilities will ensure Basic Emergency Obstetric care services are available at the primary care centres whilst tertiary centres will be targeted with specialized equipment for surgery. The project is in consonance with Government recovery programmes for North Eastern Nigeria such as the Buhari Plan, PCIN and UNFPA works very closely with the SMOH to ensure no duplication of services. The project will focus on the LGAs of Mobbar, Kala Balge and Bamma where needs for returnees IDPs, refugees and host populations continue to be high. IDP camp based facilities in these locations will be the prioritized as per recommendations of the SRH sub working group. UNFPA will work closely with partners on the ground in these locations and take advantage of the newly established humanitarian hubs and UNHAS services to monitor implementation.
